title: European Clearing House for Open Robotics Development

author: Florian Röhrbein, Fakultät für Informatik, TU Munich

segmentation: Good afternoon.
The title of the session is beyond single robots.
I think this makes perfectly sense for the Echo project.
I haven't counted all the robots we have in this project and by my talk will also not be scientific in nature.
I would rather like to give an overview about what the second project is about.
My name is from the Bourbon.

So the main.
Motivation for this Eco project was and still is the observation that there is a substantial gap between robot manufacturers and the research that is conducted at European universities.
And so the aim of the Echo project is to to at least substantially reduce this gap by a couple of methods.

Robotics Project ever funded by the European Commission.

Finally.

51 are currently running five on display below and also these systematic bidirectional exchange.
What we call structured dialogue.
Thank you very much for your attention and your interest.
